meanings.definition: The branch of physics that deals with the interaction between electric currents and magnetic fields.
meanings.sent1: Studying electrodynamics helps us understand how electricity and magnetism work together.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use electrodynamics to explain the relationship between electric currents and magnetic fields.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for electrodynamics sparked an electrifying discussion in class.
meanings.sent4: In the world of electrodynamics, electric currents dance with magnetic fields in a mesmerizing tango.
meanings.sent5: The textbook vividly illustrated the concept of electrodynamics through colorful diagrams and explanations.

meanings.definition: The study of the behavior of electric charges in motion.
meanings.sent1: Understanding electrodynamics helps us predict how electric charges move.
meanings.sent2: Electric charges in motion are the focus of study in electrodynamics.
meanings.sent3: The playful electrons in electrodynamics seemed to have a mind of their own.
meanings.sent4: In the world of electrodynamics, electric charges perform a captivating ballet.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the concept of electrodynamics come alive with exciting experiments and demonstrations.
